alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 10:18PM CDT until April 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mitchell County in north central Iowa... Southwestern Mower County in southeastern Minnesota... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 1017 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Ansgar, or 11 miles east of Northwood, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Lyle around 1035 PM CDT. Stacyville around 1040 PM CDT. Rose Creek around 1050 PM CDT. Adams around 1055 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include County Roads A 39 And S 70, Meyer, Toeterville, County Roads 56 And 5, Otranto, Otranto Park and County Roads T 54 And A 31. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 184 and 189. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota.
